messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] NEUC and other conferences
messages.msgSnippet: I m writing to people on the side who ask for information on these outings and Always-Learning-based gatherings, because I don t want to fill the list up
messages.messageBody:
I'm writing to people on the side who ask for information on these "outings" and Always-Learning-based gatherings, because I don't want to fill the list up with what are still and all regional events.

Here's something new on June 30 in Leiden, though, since I'm in there anyway.

http://sandradoddleiden.wordpress.com/

(Thanks, Rippy, for all that organization.)

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: NEUC and other conferences
messages.msgSnippet: I heard Sandra (and Holly) speak at the Good Vibrations conference in San Diego last September, which was incredibly inspiring after reading her words here for
messages.messageBody:
I heard Sandra (and Holly) speak at the Good Vibrations conference in San Diego last September, which was incredibly inspiring after reading her words here for so long. In fact the whole conference was extremely worthwhile, both for myself, and my partner Mike, who got to share experiences with other dads. We both came away with our commitment to unschooling enriched and strengthened.

Sandra, if you and Joyce are considering coming to Australia, I'm already excited! I second Natarsha's offer of help - please feel free to contact me anytime.

Claire

messages.subject: Re: NEUC and other conferences
messages.msgSnippet: ... Please please please come to Australia! ... I am probably travelling to Boston mid-2013 (June/July) and have been trying to get a sense of whether any
messages.messageBody:
--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Dodd <Sandra@...> wrote:

Please please please come to Australia!

> And the first whiff of a yet-nebulous plan. Joyce Fetteroll and I are talking about a possible/probable trip to Australia and India late in 2013.

I am probably travelling to Boston mid-2013 (June/July) and have been trying to get a sense of whether any unschooling conferences will be on around that time that I could get to. The thought of being able to go to one in the U.S. and hear you and Joyce speak here in Australia is very exciting. :)

Ann-Marie

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: NEUC and other conferences
messages.msgSnippet: -=-I know it was only a whiff! But... I am in FNQ (Far North Queensland) Australia and would be more than happy to help in any way with Sandra and Joyce coming
messages.messageBody:
-=-I know it was only a whiff! But... I am in FNQ (Far North Queensland) Australia and would be more than happy to help in any way with Sandra and Joyce coming here. I would love to be pointed in the direction of how I can assist, Natarsha.-=-

Start saving money now so that in October 2013 or whenever it ends up being, you can afford to fly to Brisbane to hang out. It's long enough to get some savings going. :-)

And that goes for others here, too. If you're interested in the Always Learning Live Symposium in Albuquerque in December, if you put $25 or so a month away, depending how far away you live, you might be able to do that (at least one adult, if not the whole family).

If your kids were in a private school, it would cost some money.
If you were required by law to study education in order to be homeschoolers, that would cost some money.
Although no one is *required* to go to a symposium to learn more, it can help hugely, and compared to "professional training," they're very inexpensive.

Sandra

messages.messageBody: I know it was only a whiff! But... I am in FNQ (Far North Queensland) Australia and would be more than happy to help in any way with Sandra and Joyce coming here. I would love to be pointed in the direction of how I can assist, Natarsha.

messages.subject: NEUC and other conferences
messages.msgSnippet: If you re interested in the northeast conference (near Boston) or any other conference, please sign up with that site to get updates.  I want to keep this
messages.messageBody:
If you're interested in the northeast conference (near Boston) or any other conference, please sign up with that site to get updates. I want to keep this discussion international and on topic as much as we can.

The Northeast Unschooling Conference super early bird registration is up until January 31, 2012. Go check it out, and register SOON to receive this awesome price!

northeastunschoolingconference.com

-----------

So while I'm at it, I'll be in Europe this summer and people can sign up for news and announcements of that here (or just to look at the blog to see the photos as they come up in those days).
http://sandraeurope2012.blogspot.com/

And in December there will be another Always Learning Live gathering in Albuquerque, so if you're interested, please subscribe!

http://allunschooling2012.blogspot.com/

There are a couple of other U.S. things
http://aboutunschooling.blogspot.com/
(lower righthand column)

AND a conference in Florida has just been announced, and I might be a speaker, but it's still in the planning and pre-announcement stages.
http://floridaunschoolingconference.com/

Apologies to those for whom these things are too far away to attend.

And the first whiff of a yet-nebulous plan. Joyce Fetteroll and I are talking about a possible/probable trip to Australia and India late in 2013.

Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
